intro: Chylismia cardiophylla, commonly known as the heart-leaf chylismia, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves, which are thick and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xerophytic conditions, thriving in low-water environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
